name: Patrizio von Samsa
appearance: A reclusive middle-aged to elderly man of German descent. He dresses conservatively and neatly, favoring dark, formal clothing. His demeanor is restrained and distant, giving the impression of a man who prefers solitude and control.
personality: Cold, calculating, ambitious, and intellectually arrogant. Patrizio believes he understands human nature better than others and sees people primarily as subjects to be studied or controlled. He is patient, manipulative, and deeply convinced of his own righteousness.
background: Patrizio von Samsa is a German immigrant whose grandfather was among the last nobility of the German Empire and fled to the United States after the November Revolution. Raised with the weight of a lost aristocratic identity, Patrizio received an elite education and became a psychiatrist. In late 1986, he participated in a six-month exchange program in Arkham, Massachusetts. There, he encountered a bizarre psychiatric case involving an Innsmouth native displaying dissociative states, inhuman strength, and unnatural intelligence. This experience fundamentally altered Patrizio’s worldview and set him on a path that eventually led him away from medicine and toward politics, using his psychological expertise to pursue power and influence in Cassandra.
goals: To gain political power and reshape society according to his understanding of human nature
To continue researching and exploiting abnormal psychological and inhuman phenomena
secrets: His interest in psychiatry was driven by a desire to control and experiment on others rather than to heal
His political ambitions are rooted in knowledge gained from unnatural encounters in Arkham
He employs Martin Gin (Ghost Hand) as a hacker and courier, and knows Ghost Hand is the murderer of both the 2002 and 2003 murder cases
He ordered the killing of Lucifero because she intercepted the Borrachero package and was mistakenly identified as the hacker who stole his secrets
He is preparing a ritual to awaken Cthulhu and other Great Old Ones, which will actually summon Ghatanothoa instead

clues.clueText: He once treated a patient from Innsmouth who exhibited multiple personalities and inhuman strength.
His shift from psychiatry to politics was triggered by encounters with unnatural phenomena.
He employs Martin Gin (Ghost Hand) who is the murderer of both the 2002 Paradil Hotel murder case and the 2003 Reindeer Bar murder case.
He ordered Lucifero's death because she intercepted the Borrachero package and was mistakenly identified as the hacker who stole his secrets.

relationships.description: A potential subject and obstacle tied to cult activities he is aware of.
relationships.history: Patrizio’s experiments and political schemes indirectly intersect with Nancy’s past involving cult rituals.

notes: Patrizio is a key antagonist whose knowledge of psychology and the Mythos allows him to manipulate both individuals and institutions while maintaining a respectable public image.
